newsitem.title: CHINA: China to curb vandalism of air defence facilities.
newsitem.headline: China to curb vandalism of air defence facilities.

text.p: China has drafted a bill aimed at preventing vandalism and destruction of air defence facilities, the Xinhua news agency said on Friday.

"Incidents of arbitrary damage and destruction of air defence facilities have occurred in recent years," Xinhua quoted Fu Quanyou, chief of the general staff of the People's Liberation Army, as saying.
"The draft was made...to prevent such incidents from happening," Xinhua said. It did not say how those who damaged air defence equipment would be punished or give details of vandalism.
